preqs: Twelve credit points of second-year Arts units.

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {ACL2%, AEH2%, AMU2%, ASA2%, ATS2%, AZA2%} or  Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {ACL2005, ACL299%, AEH299%, AMU299%, ASA2331, ASA299%, ATS2208, ATS2296, ATS2297, ATS2344, ATS2386, ATS2387, ATS2394, ATS2612, ATS2713, ATS2957, ATS299%, AZA2423, AZA299%, MON2003})

description: In this unit students will consolidate the various methodological and theoretical approaches needed in the detailed study of ancient cultures. It will review the history and evolution of such interpretation from the 19th century onwards and focus on contemporary, inter-disciplinary study. Students will explore case studies in the disciplines of ancient history, archaeology and classics, focusing upon the ancient Mediterranean and Australia.
